questiontext.text: A-10-year-old male patient, came UNHAS General Hospital with a chief complaint of crowding maxillary front teeth. Intraoral examination revealed position of teeth 11, 12, 21, and 22 in crossbite relation and palatoversion with overjet of -2 mm, overbite 1 mm. Teeth 53, 55, 63 and 65 were still exist. The mandibular dentition in normal position. First molar relationship in neutro occlusion. Extraoral examination presented straight profile. Identify the name of the malposition of the teeth in the above case..?

A-10-year-old male patient, came UNHAS General Hospital with a chief complaint of crowding maxillary front teeth. Intraoral examination revealed position of teeth 11, 12, 21, and 22 in crossbite relation and palatoversion with overjet of -2 mm, overbite 1 mm. Teeth 53, 55, 63 and 65 were still exist. The mandibular dentition in normal position. First molar relationship in neutro occlusion. Extraoral examination presented straight profile. Identify the name of the bite disorder in the above case?

A-10-year-old male patient, came UNHAS General Hospital with a chief complaint of crowding maxillary front teeth. Intraoral examination revealed position of teeth 11, 12, 21, and 22 in crossbite relation and palatoversion with overjet of -2 mm, overbite 1 mm. Teeth 53, 55, 63 and 65 were still exist. The mandibular dentition in normal position. First molar relationship in neutro occlusion. Extraoral examination presented straight profile. What is an overbite...?

answer.text: Horizontal distance from the incisal edge of the maxillary incisor to the incisal edge of the mandibular tooth when in occlusion
b. Transverse distance from the incisal edge of the maxillary incisor to the incisal edge of the mandibular tooth when in occlusion
The vertical distance from the incisal edge of the maxillary incisor to the incisal edge of the mandibular tooth when in occlusion
Sagittal distance from the incisal edge of the maxillary incisor to the incisal edge of the mandibular tooth when in occlusion

questiontext.text: A-10-year-old male patient, came UNHAS General Hospital with a chief complaint of crowding maxillary front teeth. Intraoral examination revealed position of teeth 11, 12, 21, and 22 in crossbite relation and palatoversion with overjet of -2 mm, overbite 1 mm. Teeth 53, 55, 63 and 65 were still exist. The mandibular dentition in normal position. First molar relationship in neutro occlusion. Extraoral examination presented straight profile. Mention the classification of Angle malocclusion, Dewey modification in the above case..?

A-10-year-old male patient, came UNHAS General Hospital with a chief complaint of crowding maxillary front teeth. Intraoral examination revealed position of teeth 11, 12, 21, and 22 in crossbite relation and palatoversion with overjet of -2 mm, overbite 1 mm. Teeth 53, 55, 63 and 65 were still exist. The mandibular dentition in normal position. First molar relationship in neutro occlusion. Extraoral examination presented straight profile. Mention the reference points in determining the patient's facial profile above...?

answer.text: Glabela, Ala Nasi and lower lip contour

questiontext.text: A clinical dental student will analyze the study model of his 9-year-old patient. It is known that the position of teeth 12 and 22 are in crossbite and palatoversion relation. Available space in the right lower quadrant of the mandible is 22.4 mm and the left is 20.3 mm. The space requirement for the mandibular canines and premolars according to Moyers' table is 21.8 mm. The relation of the first permanent molars to neutrocclusion. What is the conclusion of the Leeway space in the mandibular arch??

answer.text: There is a lack of space in the right quadrant of 0.6 mm and the left there is an excess of 1.5 mm
There is an excess of space in the right quadrant of 1.5 mm and the left there is a lack of 0.6 mm
There is a lack of space in the right quadrant of 1.5 mm and the left there is an excess of 0.6 mm
There is an excess of space in the right quadrant of 0.6 mm and the left there is a lack of 1.5 mm

questiontext.text: A clinical dental student will analyze the study model of his 9-year-old patient. It is known that the position of teeth 12 and 22 are in crossbite and palatoversion relation. Available space in the right lower quadrant of the mandible is 22.4 mm and the left is 20.3 mm. The space requirement for the mandibular canines and premolars according to Moyers' table is 21.8 mm. The relation of the first permanent molars to distoocclusion. What is the conclusion of the Leeway space in the mandibular arch??

answer.text: There is a lack of space in the right quadrant of 8.5 mm and the left there is an excess of 6.4 mm
There is an excess of space in the right quadrant of 8.5 mm and the left there is an excess of 6.4 mm
There is a lack of space in the right quadrant of 6.4 mm and the left there is a lack of 8.5 mm
There is an excess of space in the right quadrant of 6.4 mm and the left there is a lack of 8.5 mm

questiontext.text: A clinical dental student will analyze the study model of his 9-year-old patient. It is known that the position of teeth 12 and 22 are in crossbite and palatoversion relation. Available space in the right lower quadrant of the mandible is 22.4 mm and the left is 20.3 mm. The space requirement for the mandibular canines and premolars according to Moyers' table is 21.8 mm. The relation of the first permanent molars to mesioocclusion. What is the conclusion of the Leeway space in the mandibular arch??

answer.text: There is a lack of space in the right quadrant of 4.1 mm and the left there is an excess of 2 mm
There is an excess of space in the right quadrant of 4.1 mm and the left there is an excess of 2 mm
There is a lack of space in the right quadrant of 4.1 mm and the left there is a lack of 2 mm
There is an excess of space in the right quadrant of 4.1 mm and on the left there is a shortage of 2 mm

questiontext.text: A clinical dental student will analyze the study model of his 10-year-old patient. It is known that the position of teeth 12 and 22 are in edge to edge relation. Available space in the right lower quadrant of the mandible is 22.4 mm and the left is 22.3 mm. The space requirement for the mandibular canines and premolars according to Moyers' table is 21.8 mm. Furthermore, the Leeway space value will be obtained. What is the normal Lee way space value for the mandibular arch according to Moyers...?

A clinical dental student will analyze the study model of his 10-year-old patient. It is known that the position of teeth 12 and 22 are in edge to edge relation. Available space in the right lower quadrant of the mandible is 22.4 mm and the left is 22.3 mm. The space requirement for the mandibular canines and premolars according to Moyers' table is 21.8 mm. Space requirements for mandibular canines and premolars as measured on X-rays for the right quadrant are 22.2 mm and the left are 22.1 mm. What is the correct mixed dentition analysis method used in the above case?
